Include request correlation IDs using uuid ^9.0.1. Create logs/app.log and logs/error.log with rotation using winston-daily-rotate-file ^4.7.1.
tasks.testStrategy: Test error scenarios and verify proper logging. Test log rotation and file creation. Verify error messages are user-friendly while maintaining detailed logs for debugging.

subtasks.title: Set up Winston logging
subtasks.description: Install and configure the Winston logging library for the application, ensuring a centralized and customizable logger setup.
subtasks.details: Install Winston via npm, create a logger instance using winston.createLogger, and configure basic transports and formats for structured logging.

subtasks.title: Define error classes
subtasks.description: Create custom error classes to standardize error handling and enable structured error logging.
subtasks.details: Implement a base error class and extend it for specific error types (e.g., ValidationError, NotFoundError) to provide consistent error structure and metadata.

subtasks.title: Implement error middleware
subtasks.description: Develop middleware to handle errors, log them using Winston, and send appropriate responses to clients.
subtasks.details: Create Express middleware that catches errors, logs relevant details with Winston, and formats error responses based on error class.

subtasks.title: Add correlation IDs
subtasks.description: Integrate correlation IDs into requests and logs to enable traceability across distributed systems.
subtasks.details: Generate or extract a correlation ID for each incoming request, attach it to the request context, and include it in all log entries for that request.

subtasks.title: Configure log rotation
subtasks.description: Set up log rotation to manage log file sizes and retention, ensuring logs are archived and old logs are removed as needed.
subtasks.details: Integrate a Winston transport (such as winston-daily-rotate-file) to automatically rotate log files based on size or time, and configure retention policies.

subtasks.title: Integrate logging throughout the application
subtasks.description: Ensure consistent and meaningful logging across all application modules and layers.
subtasks.details: Refactor application code to use the centralized Winston logger for all log events, including informational, warning, and error messages, and ensure correlation IDs are included.

tasks.title: Update Existing Scrape Command Architecture
tasks.description: Migrate the existing scrape command to use the new modular architecture and N8N routing service
tasks.details: Refactor commands/scrape.js to use the new N8N routing service. Implement command validation using Joi schemas. Add proper error handling and user feedback. Structure: commands/scrape/index.js (main handler), commands/scrape/validator.js (input validation), commands/scrape/transformer.js (data transformation). Use Discord.js v14 SlashCommandBuilder for command definition. Implement ephemeral responses for better UX.
tasks.testStrategy: Test scrape command with various URL inputs. Verify error handling for invalid URLs and N8N failures. Test response formatting and ephemeral message behavior.

subtasks.title: Refactor Main Handler
subtasks.description: Modularize the main handler by extracting responsibilities into focused functions or classes, improving readability and maintainability.
subtasks.details: Apply extract method and preparatory refactoring techniques to split complex logic into smaller, testable units. Ensure existing functionality is preserved by running tests after each change.

subtasks.title: Implement Input Validation
subtasks.description: Add robust input validation to ensure all incoming data meets required formats and constraints before processing.
subtasks.details: Define validation rules for each input parameter. Integrate validation checks at the entry point of the handler, returning clear error messages for invalid inputs.

subtasks.title: Add Data Transformation
subtasks.description: Introduce data transformation logic to convert validated inputs into the required internal formats or structures.
subtasks.details: Implement transformation functions that map raw inputs to domain models or DTOs as needed for downstream processing.

subtasks.title: Integrate Error Handling and User Feedback
subtasks.description: Enhance the handler with comprehensive error handling and user feedback mechanisms.
subtasks.details: Catch and handle exceptions gracefully, providing actionable feedback to users. Ensure all error cases are covered and responses are consistent.

subtasks.title: Update Command Definition and Response Handling
subtasks.description: Revise the command definition and response logic to align with the refactored handler and new validation, transformation, and error handling flows.
subtasks.details: Update command schemas, adjust response formats, and ensure integration with any new or updated services. Test end-to-end to confirm correct behavior.

tasks.title: Create Command Registration and Deployment System
tasks.description: Implement automatic Discord slash command registration and deployment system
tasks.details: Create scripts/deployCommands.js using Discord.js REST API. Implement command discovery from commands/ directory. Support for guild-specific and global command deployment. Use @discordjs/rest ^2.2.0 and discord-api-types ^0.37.61. Include command cleanup for removed commands. Add environment-specific deployment (dev guild vs global). Implement command versioning and update detection.
tasks.testStrategy: Test command registration in development guild. Verify command updates and deletions. Test global vs guild-specific deployment scenarios.

subtasks.title: Script for Command Discovery
subtasks.description: Develop a script to dynamically discover and load all command files from the designated commands directory, ensuring each command contains the required properties.
subtasks.details: The script should recursively scan the commands directory, validate each command file for required properties (e.g., 'data' and 'execute'), and prepare them for registration.[2][3]

subtasks.title: Implement Registration via Discord.js REST API
subtasks.description: Use the Discord.js REST API to register discovered commands with Discord, handling both bulk and individual command registration.
subtasks.details: Utilize the REST and Routes modules from discord.js to send PUT requests to the appropriate Discord API endpoints, registering the commands for the application.[1][3][5]

subtasks.title: Support Guild/Global Deployment
subtasks.description: Add logic to deploy commands either to a specific guild or globally, based on configuration or environment variables.
subtasks.details: Implement conditional logic to choose between Routes.applicationGuildCommands and Routes.applicationCommands, allowing for both guild-specific and global command registration.[3][5]

subtasks.title: Command Cleanup for Removed Commands
subtasks.description: Implement a mechanism to detect and remove commands from Discord that are no longer present in the local command set.
subtasks.details: Compare the currently registered commands on Discord with the local set and issue DELETE requests for any commands that have been removed locally, ensuring no orphaned commands remain.

subtasks.title: Environment-Specific Deployment Logic
subtasks.description: Incorporate environment-aware logic to control deployment behavior, such as using test guilds in development and global deployment in production.
subtasks.details: Use environment variables or configuration files to determine the deployment target (guild or global) and other environment-specific settings, ensuring safe and appropriate command registration for each environment.

subtasks.title: Command Versioning and Update Detection
subtasks.description: Implement versioning for commands and logic to detect changes, triggering updates only when command definitions have changed.
subtasks.details: Track command versions (e.g., via a version field or hash of the command data) and compare with the registered versions on Discord, updating only those commands that have changed to minimize unnecessary API calls and downtime.

tasks.title: Implement Multi-Endpoint Command Routing
tasks.description: Create the core routing system that maps different Discord commands to specific N8N webhook endpoints
tasks.details: Extend the N8N routing service to support command-to-endpoint mapping. Create services/commandRouter.js that reads from configuration and routes commands appropriately. Implement endpoint selection logic, load balancing for multiple endpoints of same type, and failover mechanisms. Use Map data structure for efficient command lookup. Include endpoint health monitoring with periodic checks.
tasks.testStrategy: Test routing for different command types. Verify failover behavior when endpoints are down. Test load balancing with multiple endpoints. Mock various N8N response scenarios.

subtasks.title: Extend Routing Service for Command Mapping
subtasks.description: Enhance the existing routing service to support mapping of commands to their respective endpoints, enabling dynamic routing based on command type.
subtasks.details: Update the routing logic to associate each command with one or more endpoints. Ensure the service can handle new command types and update mappings as needed.

subtasks.title: Implement Endpoint Selection Logic
subtasks.description: Develop logic to select the most appropriate endpoint for a given command, considering factors such as endpoint type, security, and precedence.
subtasks.details: Incorporate rules for endpoint selection, such as prioritizing secure endpoints or using route template precedence to determine the best match for each command.

subtasks.title: Add Load Balancing
subtasks.description: Integrate load balancing mechanisms to distribute incoming commands evenly across available endpoints.
subtasks.details: Implement algorithms such as round-robin or least-connections to balance the load and prevent any single endpoint from becoming a bottleneck.

subtasks.title: Implement Failover Mechanisms
subtasks.description: Introduce failover strategies to reroute commands to healthy endpoints in case of endpoint failure.
subtasks.details: Detect endpoint failures and automatically redirect traffic to backup or secondary endpoints to maintain service availability.

subtasks.title: Efficient Command Lookup with Map
subtasks.description: Optimize command-to-endpoint lookup using a Map data structure for fast and efficient routing decisions.
subtasks.details: Replace linear search or less efficient data structures with a Map to achieve constant-time lookup for command routing.

subtasks.title: Endpoint Health Monitoring
subtasks.description: Implement continuous monitoring of endpoint health to inform routing, load balancing, and failover decisions.
subtasks.details: Track the status of each endpoint using health checks and update their availability in real time for the routing service.

subtasks.title: Periodic Health Checks
subtasks.description: Schedule and execute periodic health checks on all endpoints to proactively detect failures and performance issues.
subtasks.details: Configure regular health check intervals and define criteria for endpoint health, integrating results with the health monitoring system.

tasks.title: Add New Command Types (Analyze, Monitor, Notify)
tasks.description: Implement additional command types beyond scraping to demonstrate multi-endpoint capabilities
tasks.details: Create commands/analyze/, commands/monitor/, and commands/notify/ directories. Each command should follow the modular structure established. Implement command-specific validation and data transformation. Use Discord.js SlashCommandBuilder with appropriate options (strings, choices, attachments). Include rate limiting using bottleneck ^2.19.5. Add command-specific error handling and user feedback.
tasks.testStrategy: Test each new command type independently. Verify command-specific validation and error handling. Test rate limiting behavior and user feedback.

subtasks.title: Implement analyze command
subtasks.description: Develop the core functionality for the 'analyze' command, ensuring it follows CLI best practices and modular design.
subtasks.details: Create the command structure, handle input/output, and ensure it integrates smoothly with the CLI framework.

subtasks.title: Implement monitor command
subtasks.description: Develop the core functionality for the 'monitor' command, ensuring modularity and adherence to CLI standards.
subtasks.details: Set up the command, manage input/output, and ensure it can be extended with validation and transformation logic.

subtasks.title: Implement notify command
subtasks.description: Develop the core functionality for the 'notify' command, maintaining consistency with other commands.
subtasks.details: Build the command structure, handle required arguments, and prepare for further enhancements.

subtasks.title: Add validation for each command
subtasks.description: Implement input validation for 'analyze', 'monitor', and 'notify' commands to ensure correct usage and error prevention.
subtasks.details: Define validation rules for command arguments and options, and integrate them into each command's logic.

subtasks.title: Add data transformation for each command
subtasks.description: Implement necessary data transformation logic for the input and output of each command.
subtasks.details: Ensure data is correctly formatted and processed before being used or returned by each command.

subtasks.title: Integrate rate limiting and error handling
subtasks.description: Add rate limiting and robust error handling mechanisms to all commands to ensure reliability and prevent misuse.
subtasks.details: Implement logic to restrict command execution rates and handle errors gracefully, providing clear feedback to users.

tasks.title: Implement Environment-Specific Configuration
tasks.description: Create environment-specific configurations for development, staging, and production deployments
tasks.details: Create config/environments/ directory with dev.json, staging.json, production.json. Implement environment detection using NODE_ENV. Create configuration merging logic that combines base config with environment-specific overrides. Include different N8N endpoint URLs, timeout values, and retry configurations per environment. Use config validation to ensure required values are present.
tasks.testStrategy: Test configuration loading for each environment. Verify environment-specific overrides work correctly. Test missing configuration scenarios and validation errors.

subtasks.title: Create environment config files
subtasks.description: Set up separate configuration files for each environment (e.g., .env.development, .env.staging, .env.production) and a .env.example file to document required variables.
subtasks.details: Ensure each config file contains environment-specific settings. The .env.example file should list all required variables with sample values, excluding sensitive data.

subtasks.title: Implement environment detection
subtasks.description: Develop logic to detect the current environment (e.g., development, staging, production) at runtime.
subtasks.details: Use environment variables such as NODE_ENV or a similar mechanism to determine which config file to load.

subtasks.title: Configuration merging logic
subtasks.description: Implement logic to merge base configuration with environment-specific overrides.
subtasks.details: Ensure that the merging process prioritizes environment-specific values while falling back to defaults where necessary.

subtasks.title: Add validation for required values
subtasks.description: Integrate validation to ensure all required configuration values are present and correctly formatted.
subtasks.details: Use a validation library (e.g., zod, envalid) to check types and presence of required variables, providing clear error messages for missing or invalid values.

subtasks.title: Test environment-specific overrides
subtasks.description: Verify that environment-specific configuration overrides work as expected and that validation catches errors.
subtasks.details: Write and execute tests to confirm that the correct configuration is loaded for each environment and that missing or invalid values are properly handled.

tasks.title: Add Health Checking and Monitoring
tasks.description: Implement endpoint health checking, monitoring, and admin commands for operational visibility
tasks.details: Create services/healthChecker.js with periodic health checks for all configured N8N endpoints. Implement admin commands for checking endpoint status, viewing logs, and managing configurations. Use node-cron ^3.0.3 for scheduled health checks. Create monitoring dashboard data collection. Include metrics like response times, success rates, and error counts. Store health data in memory with optional Redis integration using ioredis ^5.3.2.
tasks.testStrategy: Test health check functionality with healthy and unhealthy endpoints. Verify admin commands work correctly with proper permissions. Test monitoring data collection and storage.

subtasks.title: Implement healthChecker service
subtasks.description: Develop a service that performs health checks on the application and its dependencies, exposing a health endpoint.
subtasks.details: Create a health check controller/service using frameworks like NestJS Terminus or Express, ensuring it checks core services (e.g., database, external APIs) and returns appropriate status responses.[1][3][5]

subtasks.title: Schedule periodic health checks
subtasks.description: Set up a mechanism to run health checks at regular intervals.
subtasks.details: Use a scheduler (such as node-cron) to trigger the healthChecker service periodically, logging or acting on failures as needed.

subtasks.title: Admin commands for status/logs/config
subtasks.description: Implement admin-only commands to retrieve system status, logs, and configuration details.
subtasks.details: Provide endpoints or CLI commands restricted to admins for querying health status, viewing logs, and managing configuration.

subtasks.title: Monitoring dashboard data collection
subtasks.description: Collect and structure health and metrics data for use in a monitoring dashboard.
subtasks.details: Aggregate health check results and relevant metrics in a format suitable for dashboard visualization, ensuring real-time updates.

subtasks.title: Metrics storage (in-memory/Redis)
subtasks.description: Implement storage for health and metrics data, supporting both in-memory and Redis options.
subtasks.details: Design a storage layer that can switch between in-memory and Redis backends for persisting health check and metrics data.

subtasks.title: Integrate with node-cron
subtasks.description: Integrate the scheduling of health checks and metrics collection with node-cron.
subtasks.details: Configure node-cron jobs to trigger health checks and metrics collection/storage at defined intervals.

subtasks.title: Permission handling for admin commands
subtasks.description: Implement robust permission checks for all admin commands and endpoints.
subtasks.details: Ensure only authorized users can access admin commands for status, logs, and configuration, using role-based access control or similar mechanisms.

tasks.title: Implement Rate Limiting and Queue Management
tasks.description: Add rate limiting and queue management to handle high-volume usage and prevent API abuse
tasks.details: Implement rate limiting using bottleneck ^2.19.5 with per-user and global limits. Create queue management for N8N requests to prevent overwhelming endpoints. Use Redis for distributed rate limiting if needed. Implement priority queuing for different command types. Add queue monitoring and metrics. Include graceful degradation when limits are exceeded with informative user messages.
tasks.testStrategy: Test rate limiting with simulated high-volume requests. Verify queue behavior under load. Test priority queuing and graceful degradation scenarios.

subtasks.title: Implement Per-User Rate Limiting
subtasks.description: Develop logic to restrict the number of requests each individual user can make within a defined time window, preventing abuse and ensuring fair resource allocation.
subtasks.details: Design and integrate per-user counters, reset intervals, and enforcement mechanisms. Consider using Redis or similar for tracking counts in distributed setups.

subtasks.title: Implement Global Rate Limiting
subtasks.description: Establish a system-wide cap on the total number of requests processed across all users within a given period to protect backend resources.
subtasks.details: Track aggregate request counts and enforce global thresholds. Ensure this logic works in both single-node and distributed environments.

subtasks.title: Queue Management for N8N Requests
subtasks.description: Introduce a queuing mechanism to hold incoming requests when rate limits are reached, ensuring orderly processing and preventing overload.
subtasks.details: Implement FIFO or configurable queue structures, integrate with n8n workflow triggers, and handle queue overflow scenarios.

subtasks.title: Priority Queuing
subtasks.description: Enhance the queue to support prioritization, allowing high-priority requests to be processed ahead of lower-priority ones.
subtasks.details: Define priority levels, update queue logic to reorder or segment requests, and ensure fairness and transparency in processing.

subtasks.title: Queue Monitoring and Metrics
subtasks.description: Implement monitoring tools and metrics collection for the queue and rate limiting systems to provide visibility and support troubleshooting.
subtasks.details: Expose metrics such as queue length, wait times, rate limit hits, and throughput. Integrate with dashboards or alerting systems as needed.

subtasks.title: Redis Integration for Distributed Limits
subtasks.description: Integrate Redis to coordinate rate limiting and queue state across multiple nodes, enabling distributed scalability and consistency.
subtasks.details: Use Redis for atomic counters, distributed locks, and queue state. Ensure failover and data consistency in clustered environments.

subtasks.title: Graceful Degradation and User Messaging
subtasks.description: Design mechanisms to inform users when limits are reached or delays occur, providing clear feedback and fallback options.
subtasks.details: Implement user-facing messages for rate limit violations, queue delays, and errors. Offer retry-after headers or alternative actions where possible.

tasks.title: Create Comprehensive Testing Suite and Documentation
tasks.description: Implement full testing coverage and create comprehensive documentation for the system
tasks.details: Create comprehensive test suite using Jest ^29.7.0 with unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests. Achieve >90% code coverage. Create API documentation using JSDoc ^4.0.2. Write deployment guides, configuration documentation, and troubleshooting guides. Include Docker Compose setup with test environment. Create GitHub Actions workflow for CI/CD using actions/setup-node@v4. Add pre-commit hooks using husky ^8.0.3 and lint-staged ^15.1.0.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify test coverage meets requirements. Test CI/CD pipeline functionality. Validate documentation accuracy and completeness. Test Docker deployment scenarios.

subtasks.title: Develop Unit Tests
subtasks.description: Write and organize unit tests to verify the smallest testable parts of the codebase in isolation, ensuring individual functions and methods behave as expected.
subtasks.details: Focus on covering core logic and edge cases for each module or function. Use a testing framework appropriate for the project's language (e.g., Jest for JavaScript).

subtasks.title: Implement Integration Tests
subtasks.description: Create integration tests to validate the interaction between multiple components or modules, ensuring they work together as intended.
subtasks.details: Test the integration points such as database connections, API endpoints, and service interactions. Use tools that support integration testing and mock external dependencies where necessary.

subtasks.title: Design End-to-End Tests
subtasks.description: Develop end-to-end (E2E) tests to simulate real user scenarios and workflows, verifying the system as a whole from the user's perspective.
subtasks.details: Utilize E2E testing frameworks (e.g., Cypress, Selenium) to automate user flows, covering critical paths and edge cases across the application.

subtasks.title: Achieve Code Coverage Targets
subtasks.description: Measure and improve code coverage to meet defined targets, ensuring that tests sufficiently exercise the codebase and reduce the risk of undetected bugs.
subtasks.details: Use code coverage tools to generate reports, identify untested areas, and iteratively add tests to close coverage gaps. Set realistic, high-impact coverage goals rather than aiming for 100% indiscriminately[1][3].

subtasks.title: Generate API Documentation with JSDoc
subtasks.description: Document all public APIs using JSDoc comments to provide clear, up-to-date reference material for developers and consumers of the API.
subtasks.details: Annotate functions, classes, and modules with JSDoc comments. Use documentation generators to produce readable HTML or markdown documentation.

subtasks.title: Write Deployment Guides
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive deployment guides detailing the steps required to deploy the application in various environments.
subtasks.details: Include environment setup, configuration, dependency installation, and troubleshooting steps. Ensure guides are accessible and kept up to date with deployment changes.

subtasks.title: Set Up Docker Compose
subtasks.description: Configure Docker Compose to orchestrate multi-container setups for local development, testing, and deployment.
subtasks.details: Define services, networks, and volumes in a docker-compose.yml file. Ensure all dependencies (e.g., databases, caches) are included and properly configured.

subtasks.title: Establish CI/CD Workflow and Pre-commit Hooks
subtasks.description: Implement a CI/CD pipeline to automate testing, code coverage checks, builds, and deployments, and configure pre-commit hooks to enforce code quality standards before code is committed.
subtasks.details: Integrate with version control systems (e.g., GitHub Actions, GitLab CI). Automate running of tests, code coverage analysis, linting, and deployment steps. Use tools like Husky for pre-commit hooks to run linters and tests locally.
